content.description: A Street: Monica and Phoebe are walking to a newsstand.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you think they have yesterday’s daily news?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just wanna check my horoscope, see if it was right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. (Grabs Phoebe and turns her away) Phoebe. Don’t look now, but behind us is a guy who has the potential to break our hearts and plunge us into a pit of depression.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where? (Turns to face him) Ooh, come to Momma.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s coming. Be cool, be cool, be cool.
(The guy walks past them)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Nice hat.

content.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
content.text: Thanks.
(The guy walks on)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We should do something. Whistle.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We are not going to whistle.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do it do it do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Woo-woo!
(The guy turns round, startled. Monica points to Phoebe. The guy gets hit by a truck)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe you did that!

content.description: Hospital, the guy is in a coma and Mon and Pheebs are visiting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why did I ‘woo-hoo’? I mean, what was I hoping would happen? That-that he’d turn round and say ‘I love that sound, I must have you now’?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just wish there was something we could do. (Bends down and talks to him) Hello. Hello, Coma Guy. GET UP, YOU GIRL SCOUT! UP! UP! UP!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe nobody’s tried this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wish we at least knew his name… Look at that face. I mean, even sleeping, he looks smart. I bet he’s a lawyer.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but did you see the dents in his knuckles? That means he’s artistic.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, he’s a lawyer, who teaches sculpting on the side. And- he can dance!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! And, he’s the kinda guy who, when you’re talking, he’s listening, y’know, and not saying ‘Yeah, I understand’ but really wondering what you look like naked.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wish all guys could be like him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Phoebe are telling everyone about their coma guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are there no conscious men in the city for you two?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He doesn’t have anyone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, we-we feel kinda responsible.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe you said woowoo. I don’t even say woowoo.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, she’s coming up! She’s coming up! (Turns on the TV)

content.speaker: Jay Leno
content.text: Folks, when we come back we’ll be talking about her new book, ‘Euphoria Unbound’: the always interesting Nora Tyler Bing. You might wanna put the kids to bed for this one.
(Everyone has settled down to watch, except Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, we don’t have to watch this. Weekend At Bernie’s is on Showtime , HBO , and Cinemax .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No way, forget it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, she’s your mom!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Exactly. Weekend At Bernie’s ! Dead guy getting hit in the groin twenty, thirty times! No?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, I gotta tell you, I love your mom’s books! I love her books! I cannot get on a plane without one! I mean, this is so cool!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, you wouldn’t think it was cool if you’re eleven years old and all your friends are passing around page 79 of ’mistress Bitch.’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, Chandler, I love your mom. I think she’s a blast.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You can say that because she’s not your mom.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, please…
(Rachel opens the door to Paolo)

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Bona sera.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi sweetie. (They kiss)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When did Rigatoni get back from Rome?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Last night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, so then his plane didn’t explode in a big ball of fire?… Just a dream I had- but, phew.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey hey hey! She’s on!

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Ah! Nora Bing!

content.speaker: Jay Leno
content.text: …Now what is this about you-you being arrested i-in London? What is that all about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Your mom was arrested?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shhh, busy beaming with pride.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: …This is kind of embarrassing, but occasionally after I’ve been intimate with a man…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now why would she say that’s embarrassing?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Shhh.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: …I just get this craving for Kung Pow Chicken.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: THAT’s TOO MUCH INFORMATION!!

content.speaker: Jay Leno
content.text: Alright, so now you’re doing this whole book tour thing, how is that going?

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh, fine. I’m leaving for New York tomorrow, which I hate- but I get to see my son, who I love…

content.speaker: All
content.text: Awww!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is the way that I find out. Most moms use the phone.

content.speaker: Jay Leno
content.text: Y’know, don’t take this wrong, I-I just don’t see you a-as a mom, somehow.. I don’t mean that, I don’t mean that bad…

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh no, I am a fabulous mom! I bought my son his first condoms.
(The gang turn to look at Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …And then he burst into flames.

content.description: [Scene: The Hospital, it’s a montage of Monica and Phoebe’s visit to the hospital with My Guy playing in the background. It starts with Monica reading a newspaper to him.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Let’s see. Congress is debating a new deficit reduction bill… the mayor wants to raise subway fares again… the high today was forty-five… and- oh, teams played sports.
[Next is a shot of them dragging an enormous plant into the room, then Monica knitting a sweater, then Phoebe singing, then Phoebe shaving him and chatting to Monica]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What about Glen? He could be a Glen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nah… not-not special enough.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! How about Agamemnon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Waaay too special.

content.description: A Mexican Restaurant, Monica, Phoebe, Joey, Chandler and his mom are there.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: I am famished. What do I want… (Looks at Chandler’s menu)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please God don’t let it be Kung Pow Chicken.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh, you watched the show! What’d you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I think you need to come out of your shell just a little.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is this dive? Only you could’ve picked this place.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oooh, c’mon, shut up, it’s fun. Gimme a hug. (They both sit down) Well, I think we’re ready for some tequila.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know I am.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Who’s doing shots?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m in.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: There y’go. Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, I’m not really a shot drinking kinda guy.
(Enter Rachel and Paolo. They are both somewhat flustered)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Sorry- sorry we’re late, we, uh, kinda just, y’know, lost track of time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …But a man can change. (Downs a shot)
[Time lapse. Ross is now clearly drunk. He is holding up a shot glass to his eye like a jeweller’s eye.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyone want me to appraise anything?
(Rachel feeds something to Paolo. He eats it and licks her hand)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mrs. Bing, I have to tell you, I’ve read everything you’ve ever written. No, I mean it! I mean, when I read Euphoria at Midnight, all I wanted to do was become a writer.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh, please, honey, listen, if I can do it, anybody can. You just start with half a dozen European cities, throw in thirty euphemisms for male genitalia, and bam! You have got yourself a book.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Myyy mother, ladies and gentlemen.
[Cut to Mrs. Bing on the telephone.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Yeah, any messages for room 226?
(Ross emerges from a toilet marked ‘Chicas’)

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: You okay there, slugger?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I’m fine, I’m fine. (A woman emerges from the toilet behind him and he tries to pretend he was in the other one)

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: What is with you tonight?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing. Nothing nothing nothing.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Okay, thank you. (To Ross) It’s the Italian Hand-Licker, isn’t it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. It’s the one he’s licking.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: She’s supposed to be with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re good.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh, Ross, listen to me. I have sold a hundred million copies of my books, and y’know why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The girl on the cover with her nipples showing?

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: No. Because I know how to write men that women fall in love with. Believe me, I cannot sell a Paolo. People will not turn three hundred twenty-five pages for a Paolo. C’mon, the guy’s a secondary character, a, y’know, complication you eventually kill off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When?

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: He’s not a hero. …You know who our hero is.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The guy on the cover with his nipples showing?

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: No, it’s you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: No, really, c’mon. You’re smart, you’re sexy…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: You are gonna be fine, believe me.
(She kisses him on the cheek)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-oh…
(…Then full on the mouth)
(Enter Joey)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhhh… I’ll just pee in the street.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, the next morning. Joey is getting the door in his dressing gown—it’s Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, is Chandler here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Ross drags Joey into the hall and slams the door)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, uh, about last night, um, Chandler.. you didn’t tell… (Joey shakes his head) Okay, ’cause I’m thinking- we don’t need to tell Chandler, I mean, it was just a kiss, right? One kiss? No big deal? Right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right. No big deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In Bizarro World!! You broke the code!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What code?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t kiss your friend’s mom! Sisters are okay, maybe a hot-lookin’ aunt… but not a mom, never a mom!
(Chandler opens the door and startles them. He picks up the paper)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you guys doing out here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh.. uh.. Well, Joey and I had discussed getting in an early morning racquetball game. But, um, apparently, somebody overslept.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well, you don’t have your racket.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no I don’t, because it’s being restrung, somebody was supposed to bring me one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well you didn’t call and leave your grip size.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you guys spend waaaay too much time together. (Goes back inside and shuts the door)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m scum, I’m scum.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, how could you let this happen?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, God, I… well, it’s not like she’s a regular mom, y’know? She’s, she’s sexy, she’s…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t think my mom’s sexy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well… not in the same way…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll have you know that Gloria Tribbiani was a handsome woman in her day, alright? You think it’s easy giving birth to seven children?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I think we’re getting into a weird area here…
(Monica and Rachel’s door opens and Rachel and Paolo emerge)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’re you guys doing out here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, not playing raquetball!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He forgot to leave his grip size!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He didn’t get the goggles!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well,sounds like you two have issues.
(She and Paolo walk a little way down the hall)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Goodbye, baby.

content.speaker: Paolo
content.text: Ciao, bela.
(They kiss. Ross is watching them)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do they wait for me to do this?
(Joey and Ross go into Monica and Rachel’s apartment)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So are you gonna tell him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why would I tell him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How about ’cause if you don’t, his mother might.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you guys doing here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhhh… he’s not even wearing a jockstrap!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …What did I ask?

content.description: Hospital. Phoebe is there stroking Coma Guy’s hair, when Monica enters with a bunch of balloons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing, I just thought I’d stop by.. y’know, after the uh… that I.. y’know, so what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not really here. Just thought I’d drop these off…on the way.. my way… Do you come here a lot? Without me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. (Monica brushes Coma Guy’s hair in the other direction) No! No! …So, um, do you think he’s doing any better than he was this morning?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How would I know? I-I wasn’t here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? Not even to, um, change his PAJAMAS?! (Whips back the sheet to reveal him wearing new pajamas.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross is talking to Chandler. Joey is making a snack at the bar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re my friend. I-I had to tell you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe it. Paolo kissed my mom?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, um, I don’t know if you noticed, but he had a lot to drink, and you know how he gets when he’s drun..uh… (He has caught sight of Joey scowling at him) I can’t do this, I did it, it was me, I’m sorry, I kissed your mom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was really upset about Rachel and Paolo, and I think I had too much tequila, and Nora- um, Mrs. Mom- your Bing- was just being nice, y’know, and- But nothing happened, nothing- Ask Joey, Joey, uh, came in-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You knew about this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh… y’know, knowledge is a tricky thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I spent the entire day with you, why didn’t you tell me?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey, hey, you’re lucky I caught them when I did, or else who knows what woulda happened.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks, man, big help.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe this! What the hell were you thinking?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wasn’t- I mean, I-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, of all my friends, no-one knows the crap I go through with my mom more than you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe you did this. (Walks toward the door)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler-

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me neither, y’know what-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m still mad at you for not telling me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you mad at me for?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler-

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You gotta let me slam the door! (Leaves; slams the door)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, I didn’t kiss her, he did! (To Ross) See what happens when you break the code?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey-

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah! (Points to door) Huh? (Leaves and slams the door)

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there except for Chandler. Rachel is writing something and Monica walks up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘A Woman Undone, by Rachel Karen Green’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Thought I’d give it a shot. I’m still on the first chapter. Now, do you think his ‘love stick can be liberated from its denim prison’?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I’d say so. And there’s no ‘j’ in ‘engorged’.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Going to the hospital tonight?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You just asked me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, maybe it was a trick question. (Plays a few chords) Um, Rachel can we do this now?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Writes a little more) I am so hot!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now, here’s a picture of my mother and father on their wedding day. Now you tell me she’s not a knockout.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I cannot believe we’re having this conversation.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon! Just try to picture her not pregnant, that’s all.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Central Perk is proud to present Miss Phoebe Buffay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks. Hi, um, ’kay. I’d like to start with a song that’s about a man that I recently met, who’s, um, come to be very important to me. (Monica gives her a look) ’kay. (Sung:)
(She sees Monica sneaking out) Okay, thank you very much, I’m gonna take a short break! (Runs out, knocking over the mike stand)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, that was Phoebe Buffay, everybody. Woo!
(Enter Chandler)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What was that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, uh, Phoebe just started a…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I believe I was talking to Joey, alright there, Mother-Kisser? (Goes to the counter)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mother-Kisser… (Sees Ross’s look) I’ll shut up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler, can I just say something? I-I know you’re still mad at me, I just wanna say that there were two people there that night. Okay? Two sets of lips.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, well, I expect this from her. Okay? She’s always been a Freudian nightmare.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, well, if she always behaves like this, why don’t you say something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because it’s complicated, it’s complex- Hey, you kissed my mom!
(People turn to look)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re rehearsing a Greek play.
content.parenthetical: To the rest of Central Perk

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s very funny. We done now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Okay, you mean, you’re not gonna talk to her, you’re not gonna tell her how you feel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That would be no. Look, just because you played tonsil tennis with my mom doesn’t mean you know her. Alright? Trust me, you can’t talk to her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, ‘you’ can’t, or (Points to Chandler) you can’t? (Chandler grabs his finger) Okay, that’s my finger. (Chandler twists it and Ross goes down on one knee) That’s, that’s my knee. (To Central Perk) Still doing the play. Aaah!

content.description: The Coma Guy’s Room, Monica bursts in, closely followed by Phoebe. There is no sign of Coma Guy. His bed is empty.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, whadyou do with him?
(There is the sound of a flushing toilet and Coma Guy emerges from the bathroom)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh! You’re awake!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look at you! How, how do you feel?

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: Uh, a little woozy, but basically okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You look good!

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: I feel good! …Who are you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m Phoebe Buffay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m Monica Geller. I’ve been taking care of you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, we both have.

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: So, the Etch-a-Sketch is from you guys?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, actually it’s just from me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got you the foot massager.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know who shaved you? That was me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I read to you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I sang. (To Monica) Hah!

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: Well,… thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, my pleasure.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re welcome.

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: So. I guess I’ll see you around.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, that’s it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: “See you around?”

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: Well, what do you want me to say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe, um, “That was nice?” Admit something to me? “I’ll call you?”

content.speaker: Coma Guy
content.text: Alright, I’ll call you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t think you mean that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so typical. Y’know, we give, and we give, and we give. And then- we just get nothing back! And then one day, y’know, it’s just, you wake up, and “See you around!” Let’s go, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what? We thought you were different. But I guess it was just the coma.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s Chandler is talking with his mom.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Car’s waiting downstairs, I just wanted to drop off these copies of my book for your friends. Anything you want from Lisbon?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, just knowing you’re gonna be there is enough.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Alright, well, be good, I love you. (Kisses him and goes to leave)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You kissed my best Ross! …Or something to that effect.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: O-kay. Look, it, it was stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really stupid.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Really stupid. And I don’t even know how it happened. I’m sorry, honey, I promise it will never happen again. Are we okay now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. No. No…
[Cut to the hallway, Joey is listening to Chandler and his mom’s conversation through the door as Ross walks up.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, the forbidden love of a man and his door.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shh. He did it. He told her off, and not just about the kiss, about everything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re kidding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no. He said “When are you gonna grow up and start being a mom?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Then she came back with “The question is, when are you gonna grow up and realise I have a bomb?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ’kay, wait a minute, are you sure she didn’t say “When are you gonna grow up and realise I am your mom?”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That makes more sense.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, what’s going on now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I dunno, I’ve been standing here spelling it out for you! (Goes back to the door) I don’t hear anything. Oh, wait, wait, wait. (Looks through the spyhole)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whaddya see?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hard to tell, they’re so tiny and upside-down. Wait, wait. They’re walking away… they’re walking away… No, no they’re not, they’re coming right at us! Run! Run!
(Joey runs off down the hall. Ross tries Monica and Rachel’s apartment, but it is locked so he has to stand in the hall and pretend he wasn’t listening. Chandler and his mom come out)

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: You okay, kiddo?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Alright. (Kisses him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice save.
(She walks down the hall)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mrs. Bing.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Mr. Geller.
(She leaves)
(Ross knocks on Monica and Rachel’s door)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You mean that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, why not. (They shake hands) So I told her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? How’d it go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Awful. Awful. Couldn’ta gone worse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, howdya feel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pretty good! I told her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, see? So, maybe it wasn’t such a bad idea, y’know, me kissing your mom, uh? Huh? (Wags his finger at Chandler, then puts it down) But.. we don’t have to go down that road.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is handing out copies of her book to the gang.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Now this is just the first chapter, and I want your absolute honest opinion. Oh, oh, and on page two, he’s not ’reaching for her heaving beasts’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s a ‘niffle’?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You usually find them on the ‘heaving beasts’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, alright, so I’m not a great typist…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait, did you get to the part about his ‘huge throbbing pens’? Tell ya, you don’t wanna be around when he starts writing with those!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, that’s it! Give it back! That’s it!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Nooo!
